think_procedure: First, I read the description of the knob. The knob 'autovacuum_vacuum_insert_scale_factor' specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_vacuum_insert_threshold when deciding whether to trigger a VACUUM. The default is 0.2 (20% of table size). This parameter can only be set in the postgresql.conf file or on the server command line; but the setting can be overridden for individual tables by changing table storage parameters. There is no mention of any special values such as -1 or 0 that would change the function of the knob or disable a feature. Therefore, this knob does not have any special values and is not a 'special' knob.
